episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of quirky and historical topics, including the unique tradition of foot ironing in Egypt, a medieval battle involving a mysterious 'earth horn', the first TV advertisement made specifically for cats, and the life of a notable nudist named Dick Bacon.

facts.fact: Ironing in Egypt is traditionally a man's job, and they do it with their feet.
900 years ago, England beat Scotland in a battle with an earth horn super weapon, which scattered the Scots by frightening their cows.
In 1999, the first ever TV ad made for cats was broadcast on ITV and had an estimated viewership of three million cats.
America's nudist of the year, 1973, who also invented a contraption that allowed him to sunbathe in sub-zero temperatures, was a man called Dick Bacon.
